name: Rakshasa
lore: Rakshasas are fiends that cloak themselves in the guises of mortals, infiltrating societies to amass wealth, power, and influence. Behind the pleasing exterior lies a cruel, calculating predator with backward-facing hands and the head of a beastâ€”most often a tiger. Slain rakshasas inevitably reform on the Lower Planes and plot their revenge, making them recurring threats across lifetimes. They delight in corrupting others, using charm and deception to turn mortals against one another while savoring their victims' despair.
vulnerabilities: Piercing from magic weapons wielded by good-aligned creatures
damageImmunities: Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.description: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has Advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

multiattack.description: The rakshasa makes two Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) Psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target gains no benefit from finishing a Short or Long Rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a Remove Curse spell or similar magic.

hit.additionalEffects: If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target gains no benefit from finishing a Short or Long Rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a Remove Curse spell or similar magic.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description:
The rakshasa casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

At will: Detect Thoughts, Disguise Self, Mage Hand, Minor Illusion

3/day each: Charm Person, Detect Magic, Fly, Suggestion

1/day each: Dominate Person, Plane Shift (self only), True Seeing

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.description: The rakshasa shape-shifts into a Medium or Small Humanoid or back to its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
